title: Quest points

properties.name: description
properties.value: Quest points, often abbreviated as QP, are part of the reward players get after they complete quests. They are considered a completion measure of quests in RuneScape.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Quest pointsThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Quest Points

Quest points, often abbreviated as QP, are part of the reward players get after they complete quests. They are considered a completion measure of quests in RuneScape.

The amount of points awarded depends on the quest, ranging from 1 to 6 points. A special case is Recipe for Disaster, since it is split up into 10 sub-quests, each awarding a QP.

A full list of quests, sortable by name, amount of QP, official length and membership requirement can be found on the Quests/List.

Purely Free-to-play players can get up to 44 quest points, the current maximum amount for Members is 289. To earn the right to wear the Quest point cape, players must complete every quest.

Miniquests do not award quest points. However, four miniquests are prerequisites to acquiring the Quest point cape as they must be completed before all QP may be earned. The four miniquests are:

  • Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl — required for Horror from the Deep and Scorpion Catcher
  • Enter the Abyss — required for Devious Minds and Wanted!
  • Skippy and the Mogres — required for Rag and Bone Man II
  • Architectural Alliance — required for A Kingdom Divided

Contents

  • 1 QP requirements
  • 2 Minigames
  • 3 Other
  • 4 Trivia

QP requirements[edit | edit source]

Some activities require a player to have at least a certain amount of quest points:

  • 10 quest points, 20 Hours of Game Time and 100 Total Level are required to trade items to other players in Free-to-play.
  • 12 quest points are needed to start Black Knights' Fortress.
  • 16 quest points are needed to start Below Ice Mountain.
  • 20 quest points are needed to start Enlightened Journey and to log on bounty hunter world.
  • 32 quest points to start the Wanted! quest.
  • At 32 quest points, players can enter the Champions' Guild, to begin the ultimate free-to-play quest, Dragon Slayer I, and earn the right to wear the best free-to-play body armour.
  • 43 quest points to start the Tears of Guthix quest.
  • 55 points are required to start the Heroes' Quest, which allows access to the Heroes' Guild.
  • 100 points are required to start the Swan Song quest, which allows access to the Piscatoris Fishing Colony.
  • 107 quest points are one of the requirements to start the Legends' Quest, which admits players to the Legends' Guild.
  • 175 points are needed to start the end-fights of Recipe for Disaster.
  • 200 quest points are needed for Dragon Slayer II making it the highest requirement of any quest.
  • 250 quest points are needed to unlock a 5th slot to block a slayer task.

Minigames[edit | edit source]

  • Tears of Guthix is a minigame which can be played once a week and is unlocked by completing the prerequisite Tears of Guthix quest. The more quest points a player has, the longer they can stay in the minigame, which means they will have the chance to collect more tears and get more experience in their lowest skill.
  • Nightmare Zone is a minigame in which the player can fight bosses from previously completed quests. The more QP a player has the more bosses a player can choose to fight. Although the bosses can be only chosen in Rumble mode and there will be a fee of 22,000 coins for normal mode, and 26,000 coins for hard mode.

Other[edit | edit source]

  • Every 50 quest points unlock a block slot for Slayer tasks, up to 5 slots at 250 quest points.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • In 2001, completing some quests would add to the "influence" skill. Later, the "influence" skill was replaced by the quest point system.
  • RuneScape Classic players could have up to 112 quest points.
rawContent:
{{External|rs|rsc=Quest Points}}
[[File:Quests.png|left|130px]]
'''Quest points''', often abbreviated as '''QP''', are part of the reward [[player]]s get after they complete [[quests]]. They are considered a completion measure of quests in ''RuneScape''.

The amount of points awarded depends on the quest, ranging from 1 to 6 points. A special case is [[Recipe for Disaster]], since it is split up into 10 sub-quests, each awarding a QP.

A full list of quests, sortable by name, amount of QP, official length and membership requirement can be found on the [[Quests/List]].

Purely [[Free-to-play]] players can get up to {{Globals|quest points f2p}} quest points, the current maximum amount for [[Members]] is {{Globals|quest points}}. To earn the right to wear the [[Quest point cape]], players must complete every quest.

Miniquests do not award quest points. However, four miniquests are prerequisites to acquiring the Quest point cape as they must be completed before all QP may be earned. The four miniquests are:

* [[Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl]] — required for [[Horror from the Deep]] and [[Scorpion Catcher]]
* [[Enter the Abyss]] — required for [[Devious Minds]] and [[Wanted!]]
* [[Skippy and the Mogres]] — required for [[Rag and Bone Man II]]
* [[Architectural Alliance]] — required for [[A Kingdom Divided]]

==QP requirements==
Some activities require a player to have at least a certain amount of quest points:
*10 quest points, 20 Hours of Game Time and 100 Total Level are required to trade items to other players in [[Free-to-play]].
*12 quest points are needed to start [[Black Knights' Fortress]].
*16 quest points are needed to start [[Below Ice Mountain]].
*20 quest points are needed to start [[Enlightened Journey]] and to log on bounty hunter world.
*32 quest points to start the [[Wanted!]] quest.
*At 32 quest points, players can enter the [[Champions' Guild]], to begin the ultimate [[free-to-play]] quest, [[Dragon Slayer I]], and earn the right to wear the [[Rune platebody|best free-to-play body armour]].
*43 quest points to start the [[Tears of Guthix]] quest.
*55 points are required to start the [[Heroes' Quest]], which allows access to the [[Heroes' Guild]].
*100 points are required to start the [[Swan Song]] quest, which allows access to the [[Piscatoris Fishing Colony]].
*107 quest points are one of the requirements to start the [[Legends' Quest]], which admits players to the [[Legends' Guild]].
*175 points are needed to start the end-fights of [[Recipe for Disaster]].
*200 quest points are needed for [[Dragon Slayer II]] making it the highest requirement of any quest.
*250 quest points are needed to unlock a 5th slot to block a slayer task.

==Minigames==
*[[Tears of Guthix (minigame)|Tears of Guthix]] is a [[minigame]] which can be played once a week and is unlocked by completing the prerequisite [[Tears of Guthix]] quest. The more quest points a player has, the longer they can stay in the minigame, which means they will have the chance to collect more tears and get more experience in their lowest skill.
*[[Nightmare Zone]] is a [[minigame]] in which the [[Player character|player]] can fight [[Boss|bosses]] from previously completed quests. The more QP a player has the more bosses a player can choose to fight. Although the bosses can be only chosen in [[Rumble]] mode and there will be a fee of 22,000 coins for normal mode, and 26,000 coins for hard mode.

==Other==
*Every 50 quest points unlock a block slot for [[Slayer]] tasks, up to 5 slots at 250 quest points.

==Trivia==
*In 2001, completing some quests would add to the "influence" skill. Later, the "influence" skill was replaced by the quest point system.
*''[[RuneScape Classic]]'' players could have up to 112 quest points.
